w1 = 0.2

source.cabd98f2:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
source.607bb87f:
%%time
df1 = pd.read_csv("../input/ensembling-starter-tps-feb-2021/submission.csv")
df2 = pd.read_csv("../input/playground-series-february-21/submission_040.csv")

blended_df = df1.copy(deep=True)

blended_df['target'] = w1*df1['target'] + w2*df2['target']
print(blended_df.head())

## Blending top results!

Let's see if we can get any better results by blending the results from top performing public notebooks!

**NOTE: ALL THE CREDITS GO TO THE RESPECTIVE NOTEBOOKS AND THEIR SUBMISSIONS, I AM JUST EXPERIMENTING TO SEE IF BLENDING PRODUCES ANY BETTER RESULTS**

Credits:

* [Playground Series. February 21](https://www.kaggle.com/kirillklyukvin/playground-series-february-21/)
* [Ensembling Starter - TPS Feb 2021](https://www.kaggle.com/tunguz/ensembling-starter-tps-feb-2021)

All the respect to the above amazing people and their work!
